body: Same issue doing my head in all day, more or less identical to yours. Can't always reproduce it though, seems to happen randomly when opening a certain kind of content. I've tried a few things, the latest being to remove `%svelte.assets%` from this line: `<link rel="icon" href="%svelte.assets%/favicon.png" />` in `app.html`. Hasn't happened in a few hours since that change and the favicon is still picked up fine from `static` folder...

Exactly, I have noticed the bug is not happening all the time. Which makes it even more strange. 
I have tried to overcome the bug by loading  the favicon manually in a __layout.svelte but it did not solve the problem neither.
I can confirm that "silencing"  the bug by removal of %svelte.assets% from this line: link rel="icon" href="%svelte.assets%/favicon.png"  in app.html.proposed by rumack helped for the time being.

For info, I stumbled on this (same/similar) closed issue where you'll maybe find a better explanation and solution: https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/issues/3582#issue-1117626857. See this too: https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/pull/3234#issue-1096525421
There is also same issue discussed on StackOverflow [SvelteKit loads favicon every page request](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/70739621/sveltekit-loads-favicon-every-page-request)

I think there are two problems here:

1. favicon.png is request on each navigation (why?)
1. favicon in dev mode SOMETIMES is not found (404)

@kvetoslavnovak can you please update the issue accordingly with this numbered list if you agree?

It should be noted that even with old versions of SvelteKit (of December or even earlier) the favicon was requested at each navigation.

Does setting the `trailingSlash` option to `always` (on platforms that need it) solve the issue, per https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/issues/3582#issue-1117626857? If not, can someone provide a minimal repro?

> Does setting the `trailingSlash` option to `always` (on platforms that need it) solve the issue, per [#3582 (comment)](https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/issues/3582#issue-1117626857)?

Nope. I cannot create a repro now (due to lack of time).

Sorry, just seeing these last exchanges now. I went back into the three Sveltekit apps where I was getting this error and reinserted `%svelte.assets%/favicon.png`, after adding `trailingSlash: 'always'` to `svelte.config.js`. Error seems to be gone. Using the node adapter.
Cheers!

I'm on `SvelteKit v1.0.0-next.295` with `adapter-static@1.0.0-next.29` and with or without `trailingSlash: 'always'` the favicon problem is still there.

I can fix it using a static `<link rel="icon" href="/favicon.png" />`.

Using `%svelte.assets%/favicon.png` instead doesn't work because in the inner pages it adds routes prefix to path, ex: `/players/favicon.png` instead of `/favicon.png`.

> Sorry, just seeing these last exchanges now. I went back into the three Sveltekit apps where I was getting this error and reinserted `%svelte.assets%/favicon.png`, after adding `trailingSlash: 'always'` to `svelte.config.js`. Error seems to be gone. Using the node adapter. Cheers!

Sorry, I spoke too soon. Error not fixed. I've had to remove the `%svelte.assets%` from `app.html` again. Otherwise I get 404 errors as it looks for routes that don't exist - somehow `/favicon` is appended onto normal routes which then can't be found...
Run into this issue today on vercel with latest auto adapter (35) and kit (317)

Again, we need a minimal repro if we're to investigate this. "See the structure in the picture above" does not count â€” see https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/blob/master/.github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE/bug_report.yml

Here's what I see when I run that reproduction locally â€” it works correctly, whether I'm doing a server-side or client-side navigation: Aside: this isn't the point of this issue, but in the repro README you ask > And why is there an SSR request anyway? If we are going to ssr the page, should it not be done before the page is hydrated ;D? The reason is that you're [calling `fetch` when the component initialises](https://github.com/Vehmloewff/sveltekit-favicon-request/blob/629de92f5189394e391ac01586083d1fe375371e/src/routes/blog/%5Bpost%5D.svelte#L14-L16). That `fetch` really belongs in the component's `load` function, but if you really _must_ put it inside the component itself, it should be inside an `onMount` otherwise the `fetch` will happen during SSR but will have no effect (because by the time it resolves, the page has already rendered).

I have a similar "problem" (quotes because it does not really break anything but my client wants to get rid of errors in the console).

I noticed that only Chrome/Chromium loads the favicon on each navigation, on Firefox it is fine.

The issue (console errors) happens when the url generated by `%svelte.assets%` (which is relative) is no longer valid when resolving to the url after navigating. This happens when navigating from `/` with `href="./favicon.png"` to `/foo/bar`. Then the `href` stays the same but Chromium tries to resolve the favicon from `/foo/favicon.png` which is obviously incorrect.

Again this does not break anything but is only annoying.

@Rich-Harris try to reproduce it in stackblitz with no fruits. locally it happens if this is your first time doing `npm run dev`.

- clone [repo](https://github.com/dangelomedinag/magacine)
- npm i
- add .env ( OMDB_API_KEY=eedc324b ) // not real project
- npm run dev
- click to the movie "Captain Marvel" or any other.

the `[id]` parameter of the `/api` route displays the following on the console
```bash
=======[7:53:11]=======
[id] === tt3438640]
=======[7:53:11]=======
[id] === favicon.png]
res => error: Incorrect IMDb ID.
===============
```

considerations:
you don't always get the error. This is usually the first time you've run `npm run dev` so you might want to try it a couple of times. in my case it makes a fetch call that should not happen, since the parameter [id=favicon.png] results in an incorrect IMDb ID of https://omdbapi.com/



![cdp-svletekit-bug-favicon](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/64056830/168590067-41e8a400-acf9-436d-8adc-407421de57f9.png)

this seems like a good explanation @fehnomenal  https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/issues/3748#issuecomment-1125980897
> I have a similar "problem" (quotes because it does not really break anything but my client wants to get rid of errors in the console).
> 
> I noticed that only Chrome/Chromium loads the favicon on each navigation, on Firefox it is fine.
> 
> The issue (console errors) happens when the url generated by `%svelte.assets%` (which is relative) is no longer valid when resolving to the url after navigating. This happens when navigating from `/` with `href="./favicon.png"` to `/foo/bar`. Then the `href` stays the same but Chromium tries to resolve the favicon from `/foo/favicon.png` which is obviously incorrect.
> 
> Again this does not break anything but is only annoying.

issue.title: Endpoints / pages being called in Chrome that shouldn't be called while loading page
issue.body:
### Describe the bug

Not 100% sure if i'm doing something wrong but i expect this to be a bug since i can only reproduce it in Chrome and not on any other browser (didn't try Edge).

**What is going wrong?**
While navigating through my project and loading some pages i see endpoints being called that shouldn't be called. This only happens in Chrome and doesn't happen in Firefox or Safari. Easiest way to explain it is via a screen recording that can be found here, https://share.cleanshot.com/CT23BF8lyeiQ1gIJeu7L

I added a console.log in each endpoint that is called when the endpoint is triggered, while clicking through the site with Chrome you will notice that multiple console.logs are logged to the terminal after a click while clicking through the exact same website with Firefox only 1 console.log is logged to the console.

### Reproduction

The exact same code as used in the video can be found here, https://github.com/ReindDooyeweerd/sveltekit-bug

### Logs

_No response_

### System Info

```shell
System:
    OS: macOS 12.4
    CPU: (16) x64 Intel(R) Core(TM) i9-9980HK CPU @ 2.40GHz
    Memory: 984.67 MB / 32.00 GB
    Shell: 5.8.1 - /bin/zsh
  Binaries:
    Node: 16.15.0 - ~/.nvm/versions/node/v16.15.0/bin/node
    npm: 8.5.5 - ~/.nvm/versions/node/v16.15.0/bin/npm
  Browsers:
    Chrome: 102.0.5005.61
    Chrome Canary: 104.0.5096.0
    Edge: 102.0.1245.30
    Firefox: 100.0.1
    Safari: 15.5
```


### Severity

annoyance

### Additional Information

_No response_

body:
Doesn't happen on Firefox. 
Happens on Chrome when you go into a subroute (e.g. from `/a` to `/a/b`). I think the reason for this that the link somehow doesn't update and Chrome requests the favicon again. Initially, the link is `./favicon.png` and resolves to `/favicon.png`. When you go to `/a/b` the link is still same (`./favicon.png`) and now resolves to `/a/favicon.png` which is the wrong path and Chrome requests it again. When I refresh the page while I am on `/a/b`, the link becomes the correct one `../favicon.png` and resolves to the correct `/favicon.png`.
